attributes.action: prevent the 25000 yearly deaths from venous thromboembolism contracted in NHS hospitals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the light of recent reports about MRSA and C.Dif. , deaths rising to around 5400 in the last year 2004-5, we feel that the policy of providing thromboprophylaxis to patients at risk is investigated. 
The House of Commons Health Select Committee reported in 2005 that the deaths from venous thromboembolism (VTE) contracted in hospital were estimated at 25000 - 32000 per year, 5 times greater than those of those from MRSA and C.Dif. combined.
"Safe, efficacious and cost effective methods are available" to prevent these deaths yet the policy needed to ensure that these deaths are presented is not in place.
Surely this needs to be addressed with at least the same urgency as the MRSA/C.Dif. deaths.
